item.title: Wizard of Legend 2: Starting Elements, Explained
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Fire
  • Water
  • Earth
  • Air
  • Lightning

Wizard of Legend 2 is a roguelike action game where 1–4 players participate in the Trials of Legend. Using a wide assortment of elemental spells (known as Arcana), you'll have to overcome countless enemies and come up with powerful spell combinations to pass the Trials and become the Wizard of Legend.

When you first start Wizard of Legend 2 , you'll be given the choice of five different Elements. This will determine your initial set of Arcana and your first Relic, though naturally, you can unlock all the other options later on with enough time and effort. This guide will examine the five starting options, break down their effects and utility, and suggest which ones will serve new players the best based on the playstyle that element offers.

Fire

Choosing Fire as your element at the beginning of the game gives you the Fireball Basic Arcana, the Flame Breath Signature Arcana, and the Flying Kicks Standard Arcana. This setup is built around mid-range combat, using Fireball to hit enemies at any range, Flame Breath to clear out crowds and leave the survivors burning (taking damage over time for a while), and Flying Kicks to deal some damage while retreating out of melee range.

This is a very easy setup to use and is very reliable at dishing out damage. It is further supplemented by the Starting Relic "Ifrit's Matchstick", which gives all of your Fire Arcana 15% more damage. The Fire starting loadout specializes in mid-range damage and has attacks that are effective against single targets or larger groups, making it a great all-rounder choice when beginning the game.

Water

If you choose Water at the start of the game, you'll receive Bending Torrent as your Basic Arcana, Ice Blast as your Signature Arcana, and Dragon Arcs as your Standard Arcana. Bending Torrent is an unusual projectile, lashing out in wide arcs and redirecting to find more targets if you hit the button again while it's still active. With a bit of practice, this can be used against large groups to great effect. Ice Blast is a freezing cone that prevents enemies from moving for a short while (or until they get hit), making it perfect for creating breathing room and lining up enemies for your other attacks. Dragon Arcs launches a line of fire dragons in the direction you're facing and has excellent range, making it ideal for picking off enemies at a distance or dishing out a ton of damage to a frozen foe.

Choosing the Water element also provides you with the Starting Relic "Shiva's Water Bottle", increasing all Water Arcana damage by 15%. The Water Element starting loadout is excellent at dishing out damage to groups of foes, while using Ice Blast to lock down troublesome targets and line up your damaging combos. Once you get the hang of Bending Torrent's unconventional movement, this setup can be exceptional.

Earth

Choosing the Earth Element gives you an excellent but slow melee setup, with Earth Knuckles as your Basic Arcana, Stonestrike Kick as your Signature Arcana, and Lightning Spear as a Standard Arcana. Earth Knuckles is a slow but strong melee attack that can deal a lot of damage and easily hit multiple targets due to the sheer size of your earth fists. Stonestrike Kick is another melee strike that moves you forward and knocks enemies back while inflicting fracture. Fracture causes afflicted enemies to take damage whenever they move, willingly or by force. Finally, Lightning Spear is a stunningly strong ranged attack that knocks enemies airborne while also inflicting shock. Shock prevents the enemy from taking actions while inflicting lightning damage periodically, and enemies knocked airborne will stay helpless in the air as long as you keep hitting them with attacks.

Choosing the Earth Element also gives you the Relic "Gaia's Shovel", increasing your Earth Damage by 15%. Earth's starting loadout is focused on stunning enemies, shoving them around, and delivering crushing melee strikes. This makes it a great beginner's choice if you want a melee build when starting out.

Air

When you pick the Air Element, you'll begin the game with Aeromancer's Grasp, Zephyr Whirl, and Terra Ring. The Air Element starting Arcana are all melee Arcana, making it the perfect choice for getting up close and personal with your enemies. Aeromancer's Grasp is a Basic Arcana that unleashes a wind-infused punch combo and will dash you towards the enemy you're facing if you're within a certain distance, making it perfect for initiating combat and getting in close. Once you're in the thick of it, Zephyr Whirl allows you to create a brief whirlwind that pulls enemies toward you and inflicts slow, bringing them to you right in time to use Terra Ring. Terra Ring is a Standard Arcana that creates a ring of earth spikes around you, spreading outward and dealing damage to every enemy they hit,

Choosing Air will also give you the Relic "Rudra's Pinwheel", increasing all Air Damage you deal by 15%. As mentioned earlier, the initial Air Element loadout specializes in Melee Arcana, working best when you stay on the move, dashing into and out of danger and pulling enemies in to unleash your heavier attacks. While a little tricky to get the hang of, this loadout can be very satisfying once you get the combos down.

Lightning

Choosing Lightning as your Element equips you with Bolt Rail, Volt Surge, and Blizzard. Bolt Rail is a channeled Basic Arcana that deals lightning damage in a line in front of you, allowing it to hit multiple targets at once with some good positioning. To help you line them up, Volt Surge is a Signature Arcana that bounces a lightning bolt between multiple targets while inflicting shock, which prevents afflicted enemies from taking any action and periodically deals more lightning damage to them. While Volt Surge's shock effect doesn't last very long, it's more than enough time to line up Bolt Rail or conjure up Blizzard's AOE on top of your helpless foes. Blizzard creates a circle of falling ice to deal damage to all enemies in its Area of Effect.

By choosing Lightning you'll also receive the Battery of Tanaris Relic, raising all lightning damage dealt by 15%. The Lightning Element starting loadout is focused on stunning and damaging groups of foes, making it fantastic for dealing with large groups of enemies as you traverse the Trials, though it requires players to pay extra attention to their positioning to get the most out of it.

item.title: World of Warcraft: Will Khadgar Be the Last Guardian?
item.description:
Khadgar is perhaps World of Warcraft ’s most important hero, as his origin story set the wheels of the Warcraft universe in motion. He’s been through countless calamities and averted even more, truly living up to his moniker as Azeroth’s Guardian. But Guardian used to be more than just a title.

Many World of Warcraft players may be familiar with Khadgar’s enduring presence and unrelenting wit, but his predecessor, Medivh, was the Guardian who began it all. Medivh’s actions catalyzed the initial invasion of Azeroth by the orcish Horde, way back when the Warcraft franchise was in its infancy.

The Guardian of Tirisfal Has Shaped WoW's History

Medivh was Azeroth’s Guardian for only a short while compared to his predecessors, many of whom lived for hundreds of years. The Guardian’s charge was to protect the human kingdoms from demonic attacks, as the Burning Legion was looking for any weakness to exploit. Unfortunately for Medivh, he was that weakness, and he had been corrupted from the moment of his birth. The actions of his mother Aegwynn, the Guardian before him, set this grand plan in motion, so there was little Medivh could have done to avert his tragic fate.

The errant Guardian, a mage imbued with incredible arcane abilities, instead used that power to threaten all of Azeroth by opening the Dark Portal. It was his curious apprentice, Khadgar, who unraveled the mysteries and defeated his own mentor in an epic battle. Khadgar was supposed to succeed Medivh, but it was decided that no single individual should wield such power, a sentiment that even Medivh agreed with.

Why Khadgar Didn't Become Warcraft's Next Guardian

Instead of receiving an official title and the immense power that came with it, Khadgar remained a Guardian in name only. Before Medivh died, he told Khadgar that Azeroth already had its next Guardian, and that his apprentice would succeed where he had failed. Thus, technically, Medivh was the final Guardian of Tirisfal, but Khadgar symbolically took up the role, and has been protecting Azeroth ever since. Medivh would later return in Warcraft 3 and guide several mortal heroes to save the world, though his current whereabouts and status are unknown.

How Khadgar Has Still Lived Up to the Guardian Role

Khadgar personally oversaw the final defeat of the Burning Legion in WoW' s Legion expansion, so in no small way, he fulfilled the Guardian's purpose. Despite his many years and his being the most skilled and learned mage in current World of Warcraft , Khadgar met his match in The War Within. When defending Dalaran from Xal’atath, the Harbinger, he was overwhelmed by her potent void magic. She destroyed the floating city and held onto Khadgar, though the Archmage was close to death.

Medivh Was Alone, But Khadgar Has Loyal Friends

Only through the efforts of his dear friends was Khadgar saved from certain demise. Alleria Windrunner forced Xal’atath to release him, while Anduin Wrynn found the strength to cast a vital healing spell. For a heavy moment, it was thought that the legendary Archmage had cracked his last dad joke, but just as Medivh had said, being a Guardian doesn’t require the power of a god.

At least for now, Archmage Khadgar is set to stick around, but even if he had passed on, he wouldn’t have named another Guardian as his successor. The Order of Tirisfal, the group of mages who would bestow a Guardian's power, no longer exists anyway. Azeroth has many more brave souls who would give their lives for the world they care about, and that's all that's needed. The story of the Guardian is one written in suffering and destruction, and it was Khadgar who changed that dark narrative for the better.

item.title: Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom - Get Rich Quick Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Get Rich Quick! Walkthrough
  • How to Use Goldfinch Automaton

In your Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom playthrough, you've probably noticed a sparkling object hung on the wall in someone's house. These are items that can be obtained through the completion of minigames. One object you're likely to find first is the Golden Fan at the Gerudo Oasis. Like other key items, you cannot make an Echo out of it, but you're going to need it for "Get Rich Quick!" This is a side quest you can unlock and complete in the midgame of Echoes of Wisdom , and if you need to farm Rupees, it's one you'll want to do.

Get Rich Quick! Walkthrough

How to Unlock & Complete

"Get Rich Quick!" becomes available after you've completed the "Automaton Engineer Dampe" side quest. For this, you need to find Dampe northeast of Hyrule Ranch and defeat the crows that stole his Clockwork Key . Then, you can visit Dampe's studio and start the "Automaton Engineer Dampe" quest. You'll need to show him an Echo of a Tektite and a Mothula. After this, check the journal, and you can take on three more Automaton quests. To unlock "Get Rich Quick!", you'll need to complete the three requests listed in the journal:

  • Performance Artist!
  • Chop em' in Two!
  • Endless Stomach!

Interact with the journal again to start "Get Rich Quick!" For this, you're going to need the Crow Echo and the Golden Fan . At this point, you should already have the Crow Echo. If not, you can learn the Crow Echo at the same spot where you met Dampe, or you can get it in the area between the Gerudo Desert and Lueberry's House . To get the Golden Fan , you need to play the Mango Rush minigame, which is found in the hut behind the Smoothie Shop in Gerudo Oasis . You will receive the Golden Fan for getting 50 or more Tough Mangos in the Vibrant Seeds round. If this is your first time visiting, you'll need to complete Standard Seeds (first round) before you can unlock Vibrant Seeds.

With the Golden Fan, return to Dampe's studio. Speak to Dampe, choose " I want an automaton! " and then select " Get rich quick! ". Zelda will then give Dampe the requested Golden Fan, and you'll receive the Golden Finch Automaton.

How to Use Goldfinch Automaton

How Much Rupees Does It Farm?

The Golden Finch Automaton works just as any other Automaton: Summon it by holding down left on the directional pad, and scrolling to the Golden Finch. Wind it up with the Y-button, and the Golden Finch will take flight. Like a regular Crow Echo, it'll attack enemies and cause them to drop Rupees. The Golden Finch is much faster than the Crow. When it hits its target, the enemy will drop 5 Rupees and 20 Rupees . After a while, the Golden Finch will need to be rewound. You can increase winding time by drinking a Twisty Smoothie (requires Twisted Pumpkin as one of the ingredients). Be careful the Golden Finch doesn't get too damaged. If it does, you'll need to take it to Dampe and have it repaired for a fee.

If you hold the Golden Finch and jump off a ledge, you can use it to glide a short distance, just as you can with cuccos and keese.

item.title: New Open World Multiplayer Game Has Serious Minecraft Vibes
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • 4J Studios, best known for its many Minecraft ports, has announced a new game called Reforj.
  • Reforj is an open-world survival game with multiplayer elements and voxel graphics. Its building system will allow players to not just place blocks but also sculpt them.
  • While it currently lacks a release date, Reforj has already been confirmed to be in development for both PC and consoles.

Reforj is the name of a newly announced open-world multiplayer game with some serious Minecraft vibes. Its similarity to Mojang's flagship title is even stronger on account of Reforj coming from a developer that's best known for its numerous Minecraft ports.

Minecraft is one of the most ported 21st-century games, and many of its ports were handled by 4J Studios. Over the five-year period ending in 2017, the Dundee, Scotland-based developer brought Minecraft to everything from the Xbox 360 and PS3 to their next-gen successors, PS Vita, Wii U, and the Nintendo Switch. Since then, the Scottish company made a wacky couch co-op game called Manic Mechanics , which was treated to a multi-platform release in 2023.

4J Studios Shares First Look at Voxel Sandbox Game Reforj

4J Studios has now revealed its next project in the form of Reforj , a multiplayer survival game with procedurally generated open worlds. The developer's announcement included some pre-alpha footage from the game, which shows that Reforj will boast a blocky aesthetic that makes it somewhat reminiscent of Minecraft , especially when combined with its procedural environments and mechanics. However, 4J Studios' upcoming title will utilize voxel graphics rather than rely on polygons like Minecraft does.

To that end, the Scottish company opted to create Reforj using its proprietary Elements Engine, which is specifically geared toward powering voxel sandbox experiences. 4J Studios originally unveiled this game engine back in May 2024, with Reforj hence being set to serve as its first proper showcase. In terms of its gameplay loop, 4J Studios says that its upcoming game will task players with surviving in a hostile environment by building shelters, establishing settlements, and scavenging for resources. They will also have a chance to explore the remnants of some lost civilizations and take on a variety of mobs.

Reforj's Building System Supports Sculpting Blocks

The Reforj pre-alpha footage also offers a glimpse of the game's wingsuit mechanics, which will allow players to quickly traverse large distances. While its user interface and building mechanics seem somewhat similar to Minecraft on the surface, there is one standout UI difference in that Reforj will feature a fairly detailed minimap. Likewise, the game will allow players to sculpt blocks rather than merely place them, which should be conducive to creativity.

The game itself is currently lacking a release window, though 4J Studios did confirm that it's planned to be released on both PlayStation and Xbox consoles, as well as PC. Given how Elements is specifically touted as a next-gen engine and seeing how it's already 2024, the chances of Reforj reaching the PS4 and Xbox One appear slim to none.

item.title: Starfield: Should You Kill Or Save Sahima? (Zealous Overreach)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Agreeing To Kill Sahima In Zealous Overreach
  • Saving Sahima In Zealous Overreach
  • How To Recruit Sahima In Starfield
  • What Is The Best Outcome For Zealous Overreach?

Bethesda Game Studios' open world space RPG Starfield released its first major DLC, Shattered Space , which is a handcrafted exploration of the mysterious and enigmatic House Va'ruun and its homeworld, the moon of Va'ruun'kai. Shattered Space sees a return to a more classic Bethesda formula, with a hub region filled with main quests, side quests, and discoverable locations — all available on foot. With a much more focused and defined scope, Shattered Space offers a bevy of new quests with a great Va'ruun theme.

As part of the DLC's main story quests, players will receive the Zealous Overreach quest when they attempt to pursue the Help House Ka'dic objective in the quest, Aligning the Houses. Zealous Overreach sees players on the hunt for a group of Va'ruun Zealots that House Ka'dic has become a little too close with — and who have managed to kidnap some key members of the House. There are two different pathways for completing this quest: one offered by Razma Ka'dic, the House Elder, and one by Djimal Ka'dic, the House Mediary. Razma wants to save Sahima, while Djimal wants to kill her. So, should you kill or save Sahima in Zealous Overreach?

Agreeing To Kill Sahima In Zealous Overreach

Razma's intended outcome for Zealous Overreach is for the hostages to be saved and for her grip on her group of Va'ruun Zealots to be solidified once more. But her sister, Djimal Ka'dic, the House Mediary, has other plans. She wants to see House Ka'dic end its association with the Va'ruun Zealots completely and argues that the only way for this to happen is if the hostages are killed and Razma is forced to give up her plans. Djimal frames her request as a regrettable outcome for the greater good. Whether or not you agree with her reasoning, 10000 Credits can be extracted from her for the promise of killing Sahima when she's found.

Killing Sahima

Sahima is a decent level and does put up a fight, but she's nowhere near as difficult to kill as some of the other enemies in the dungeon. But, once dead, she needs to be looted for both Sahima's Passcode and Sahima's Research .

Killing The Hostages

It's not just Sahima who needs to die to complete this objective, though. Every hostage — and Va'ruun Zealot — inside Shadow Station Epsilon has to die. So, once Sahima is found and killed, you have to go through the rest of the dungeon to kill all the hostages and hostiles. Once that's done, the major objectives of this quest will be complete.

Negotiations After Killing Sahima

After killing Sahima the negotiations with the Va'ruun Zealots go sour. Razma is angry and upset with the outcome of the quest and blames the Zealots, ending their arrangement — just as Djimal wanted. The player can pass Persuasion checks to try and avoid a fight, or they can simply kill the Va'ruun Zealots. Djimal will then grant the player a reward, progressing the quest.

Saving Sahima In Zealous Overreach

To save Sahima, players simply need to progress the quest to the point where she can be spoken to about her plans. Once she's rescued, she'll become Essential , meaning she cannot be killed after that point, and the player is locked in to saving her. Sahima will aid the player using her technical know-how, but she'll keep hold of her research until later on.

Saving The Hostages

The other hostages still need to be saved to complete the quest properly, but the Zealots don't necessarily need to be killed.

Negotiations After Saving Sahima

If Sahima is saved, the negotiations with the Va'ruun Zealots can go very differently. Sahima arrives during the negotiations and threatens the Zealots with the destruction of their base thanks to her viruses and technical know-how. Depending on player choice, this can be used to avoid a fight during this phase of the quest. After the situation is resolved, Razma will ask the player not to tell the House Va'ruun High Council of anything that's transpired. The player can agree to do so for a variety of roleplay reasons — or extort Razma for 15000 Credits instead. Afterward, Sahima will ask the player to find her at House Ka'dic where she is available as a player companion and crew member.

How To Recruit Sahima In Starfield

Sahima will return to House Ka'dic after this quest. When found, the player can offer her a spot on their ship and crew, and they can assign her to an available ship or outpost.

What Is The Best Outcome For Zealous Overreach?

The best outcome is to save Sahima and extort Razma. This grants the player a new crew member and 15000 Credits on top of the usual rewards for doing the quest. Although killing Sahima does award 10000 Credits, this amount is less than can be achieved from saving her and also does not reward a new player companion.
